channel.title: Submodule on Andrew's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Submodule on Andrew's Blog

item.title: Git clone a repository with submodules
item.description: When you clone a Git repository with submodules, you’ll realise that it does not bring down all of the branches and code for the associate submodules. A few steps need to be taken. Step 1: Clone the repository git clone <your_repository_url> Step 2: Init submodules git submodule init Step 3: Update submodules git submodule update
item.content:encoded:
When you clone a Git repository with submodules, you’ll realise that it does not bring down all of the branches and code for the associate submodules.

A few steps need to be taken.

Step 1: Clone the repository

git clone <your_repository_url>

Step 2: Init submodules

git submodule init

Step 3: Update submodules

git submodule update
